comment: She was one of the easiest teachers Ive had at KSU. There is a group project, but its required for all TCOM classes. Grading is weird, but you will get used to it. If you follow the assignment guidelines and say you deserve an A at the end, she will give you it. There was a textbook but I never opened it. Overall, very easy class, would take again.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: TERRIBLE communicator, there is 4 main projects for the semester and she has only graded 1. how are you taking THIS long to grade assignments and you don't even have in person classes to teach? she's flexible on assignment dates ill give her that, but i do not recommend her as a professor overall, she's also very rude in emails

She's an organized and thoughtful instructor. She regularly notified us of what was important or required in the course too. The entire course mainly focused on 1 major project with different milestones for us to complete. At the end, we wrote a reflective memo that basically recaps the course. It was a unique learning experience!

Do not know how to communicate well and rude in her emails. Only emails to inform how everyone is not following instructions. Her instructions are unclear and still expects perfect work. Day one I emailed her, I knew I had to drop this class but I stayed and gave zero attention in the class.

Professor Tijerina is ELITE! She cares more about learning than she does about grades and academia. She is flexible on due dates and allows students to grade themselves at the end of the semester (within reason). Her courses use free online textbooks that are actually interesting to read. I couldn't recommend her more!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This was an excellent class! Her instructions were clear and it is easy to do well in this class if you follow the instructions, put in the effort, and revise according to her corrections! You submit your assignments, she provides feedback, you revise, then submit one final portfolio at the end of the semester for grading.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Probably the worst instructor I have ever experienced. Failed an entire group for "self plagiarsm" (when you revise YOUR OWN work and submit the final revised draft. Never heard of such stupidity in my life. Tried to have the entire group fail the entire class, but realized that her instructions were unclear to begin with. 100% Worthless.

Outstanding professor that is very clear in instructions, grades very fairly, and communicates well with the class. She specifically told us the reason why this person who gave a bad review did so bad was because they didn't read the instructions. I took this class in the summer & taught at a very steady pace and not to difficult. would reccomend.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very unclear in instructions. Does not grade fairly. Says she communicates well on the syllabus, but with my experience that is not the case. Would not recommend.

Great professor. 3 major assignments through the semester and the last 2 are group projects. Grades a little differently but if you just follow the examples she gives, you can make an A. Doesn't lecture rather just gives in class assignments to help you learn. No final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This was her first semester teaching and it went well, had in class assignments and there was a group project that began at midterms and lasted till the end of the semester. I'm sure theres things that she'll tweak goin forward but she works with you and cares a lot about her students. Easy A if u stay on task and complete the assignments.
